properties.areaDesc: Camden, NJ; Philadelphia, PA; Montgomery, PA; Burlington, NJ; Chester, PA; Delaware, PA
properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 8 at 12:49PM EST until January 8 at 1:15PM EST by NWS Mount Holly NJ
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Northwestern Camden County in southern New Jersey...
Northwestern Burlington County in southern New Jersey...
Southeastern Montgomery County in southeastern Pennsylvania...
Northeastern Chester County in southeastern Pennsylvania...
Philadelphia County in southeastern Pennsylvania...
Northeastern Delaware County in southeastern Pennsylvania...

* Until 115 PM EST.

* At 1249 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located over Narberth,
or 7 miles west of Philadelphia, moving east at 40 mph.

HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

* This includes the following highways...
Interstate 295 in New Jersey near mile marker 28.
Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 17 and 33.
Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 7 and 19.
Pennsylvania Turnpike between exits 326 and 339.
Northeast Extension near exit A20.
Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4.
Interstate 676 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 1.
Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 3.
Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 351.

Locations impacted include...
Philadelphia, Camden, Gloucester City, Norristown, West Norriton,
East Norriton, Bellmawr, Yeadon, Riverside, Conshohocken, Palmyra,
Ambler, Jenkintown, Narberth, East Lansdowne, Beverly, Rockledge,
Brooklawn, Abington and Audubon Park.
properties.instruction:
Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes
your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra
time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead
to accidents.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 1:15 PM EST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
